item.title: Lea add a quote by Dylan Thomas
Lea add a quote by Alfred Lord Tennyson
item.description: "Tis better to have loved and lost Than never to have loved at all." -- Alfred Lord Tennyson

item.title: Lea add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Lea add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Lea add a quote by St. Thomas Aquinas
item.description: "Beware the man of a single book." -- St. Thomas Aquinas

item.title: Lea add a quote by Joseph Addison
item.description: "Reading is to the mind what exercise is to the body." -- Joseph Addison

item.title: Lea add a quote by Joseph Brodsky
item.description: "There are worse crimes than burning books. One of them is not reading them." -- Joseph Brodsky

item.title: Lea add a quote by Scott Corbett
item.description: "I often feel sorry for people who don't read good books; they are missing a chance to lead an extra life." -- Scott Corbett

item.title: Lea add a quote by Christopher Dawson
item.description: "The man who is fond of books is usually a man of lofty thought, and elevated opinions." -- Christopher Dawson

item.title: Lea add a quote by Margaret Fuller
item.description: "Today a reader, tomorrow a leader." -- Margaret Fuller

item.title: Lea add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I believe that everything happens for a reason. People change so that you can learn to let go, things go wrong so that you appreciate them when they're right, you believe lies so you eventually learn to trust no one but yourself, and sometimes good things fall apart so better things can fall together." -- Marilyn Monroe
